00042 class SIM_API cComponent : public cDefaultList //implies noncopyable
00043 {
00044     friend class cPar; // needs to call handleParameterChange()
00045     friend class cChannel; // allow it to access FL_INITIALIZED and releaseLocalListeners()
00046     friend class cModule; // allow it to access FL_INITIALIZED, releaseLocalListeners() and repairSignalFlags()
00047     friend class cGate;   // because of repairSignalFlags()
00048 
00049   private:
00050     enum {
00051       FL_PARAMSFINALIZED = 4,   // whether finalizeParameters() has been called
00052       FL_INITIALIZED = 8,       // whether initialize() has been called
00053       FL_EVLOGENABLED = 16,     // whether logging via ev<< is enabled
00054       FL_DISPSTR_CHECKED = 32,  // for hasDisplayString(): whether the FL_DISPSTR_NOTEMPTY flag is valid
00055       FL_DISPSTR_NOTEMPTY = 64, // for hasDisplayString(): whether the display string is not empty
00056     };
00057 
00058   private:
00059     cComponentType *componenttype;  // component type object
00060 
00061     short rngmapsize;  // size of rngmap array (RNGs>=rngmapsize are mapped one-to-one to physical RNGs)
00062     int *rngmap;       // maps local RNG numbers (may be NULL if rngmapsize==0)
00063 
00064     short paramvsize;
00065     short numparams;
00066     cPar *paramv;  // array of cPar objects
00067 
00068     cDisplayString *dispstr; // display string (created on demand)
00069 
00070     struct SignalData
00071     {
00072         simsignal_t signalID;
00073         cIListener **listeners; // NULL-terminated array
00074 
00075         SignalData() {signalID=SIMSIGNAL_NULL; listeners=NULL;}
00076         bool addListener(cIListener *l);
00077         bool removeListener(cIListener *l);
00078         int findListener(cIListener *l);
00079         int countListeners();
00080         bool hasListener() {return listeners && listeners[0];}
00081         static bool gt(const SignalData& e1, const SignalData& e2) {return e1.signalID > e2.signalID;}
00082     };
00083 
00084     typedef std::vector<SignalData> SignalTable;
00085     SignalTable *signalTable; // ordered by signalID so we can do binary search
00086 
00087     // flags to speed up emit() for signals 0..63 when there are no or few listeners
00088     uint64 signalHasLocalListeners;    // bit[k]==1: signalID k has local listeners
00089     uint64 signalHasAncestorListeners; // bit[k]==1: signalID k has listener in parent or in any ancestor component
00090 
00091     // string-to-simsignal_t mapping
00092     static std::map<std::string,simsignal_t> signalIDs;
00093     static std::map<simsignal_t,std::string> signalNames;
00094     static int lastSignalID;
00095 
00096     // stack of listener lists being notified, to detect concurrent modification
00097     static cIListener **notificationStack[];
00098     static int notificationSP;
00099 
00100   private:
00101     SignalData *findSignalData(simsignal_t signalID) const;
00102     SignalData *findOrCreateSignalData(simsignal_t signalID);
00103     void removeSignalData(simsignal_t signalID);
00104     void checkNotFiring(simsignal_t, cIListener **listenerList);
00105     template<typename T> void fire(cComponent *src, simsignal_t signalID, T x);
00106     void fireFinish();
00107     void signalListenerAdded(simsignal_t signalID);
00108     void signalListenerRemoved(simsignal_t signalID);
00109     void repairSignalFlags();
00110     bool computeHasListeners(simsignal_t signalID) const;

00115     void setEvEnabled(bool e)  {setFlag(FL_EVLOGENABLED,e);}
00116     bool isEvEnabled() const  {return flags&FL_EVLOGENABLED;}

00118     // internal: invoked from within cEnvir::getRNGMappingFor(component)
00119     void setRNGMap(short size, int *map) {rngmapsize=size; rngmap=map;}

00136

00138     bool initialized() const {return flags&FL_INITIALIZED;}

00472     bool mayHaveListeners(simsignal_t signalID) const {
00473         if ((unsigned)signalID > 63)  // note: shift must be in 0..63 (C++ spec)
00474             return true;
00475         uint64 mask = (uint64)1 << signalID;
00476         return (signalHasLocalListeners|signalHasAncestorListeners) & mask;
00477     }
00478 
00486     bool hasListeners(simsignal_t signalID) const {
00487         if (signalID < 0)  // note: result of negative shift is undefined (C++ spec)
00488             return false;
00489         if (signalID > 63)
00490             return computeHasListeners(signalID);
00491         uint64 mask = (uint64)1 << signalID;
00492         return (signalHasLocalListeners|signalHasAncestorListeners) & mask;
00493     }
